freenet.support
Class Fields

java.lang.Object
  freenet.support.Fields

public abstract class Fields
extends Object

This class contains static methods used for parsing boolean and unsigned long fields in Freenet messages. Also some general utility methods for dealing with string and numeric data.

Author:
oskar

Method Detail

hexToLong

public static final long hexToLong(String hex)
                            throws NumberFormatException
Converts a hex string into a long. Long.parseLong(hex, 16) assumes the input is nonnegative unless there is a preceding minus sign. This method reads the input as twos complement instead, so if the input is 8 bytes long, it will correctly restore a negative long produced by Long.toHexString() but not necessarily one produced by Long.toString(x,16) since that method will produce a string like '-FF' for negative longs values.

Parameters:
hex - A string in capital or lower case hex, of no more then 16 characters.
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the string is more than 16 characters long, or if any character is not in the set [0-9a-fA-f]

hexToInt

public static final int hexToInt(String hex)
                          throws NumberFormatException
Converts a hex string into an int. Integer.parseInt(hex, 16) assumes the input is nonnegative unless there is a preceding minus sign. This method reads the input as twos complement instead, so if the input is 8 bytes long, it will correctly restore a negative int produced by Integer.toHexString() but not necessarily one produced by Integer.toString(x,16) since that method will produce a string like '-FF' for negative integer values.

Parameters:
hex - A string in capital or lower case hex, of no more then 16 characters.
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the string is more than 16 characters long, or if any character is not in the set [0-9a-fA-f]

stringToBool

public static final boolean stringToBool(String s,
                                         boolean def)
Finds the boolean value of the field, by doing a caseless match with the strings "true" and "false".

Parameters:
s - The string
def - The default value if the string can't be parsed. If the default is true, it checks that the string is not "false"; if it is false, it checks whether the string is "true".
Returns:
the boolean field value or the default value if the field value couldn't be parsed.

stringToBool

public static boolean stringToBool(String s)
                            throws NumberFormatException
Find the boolean value of the field. Throw if the string is neither "yes"/"true" nor "no"/"false".

Parameters:
s -
Returns:
Throws:
NumberFormatException

Converts a boolean to a String of either "true" or "false".

Parameters:
b - the boolean value to convert.
Returns:
A "true" or "false" String.

dateTime

public static final long dateTime(String date)
                           throws NumberFormatException
Parses a time and date value, using a very strict format. The value has to be of the form YYYYMMDD-HH:MM:SS (where seconds may include a decimal) or YYYYMMDD (in which case 00:00:00 is assumed for time). Another accepted format is +/-{integer}{day|month|year|minute|second}

Returns:
millis of the epoch of at the time described.
Throws:
NumberFormatException

binarySearch

public static int binarySearch(long[] values,
                               long key,
                               int origBegin,
                               int origEnd)
Assumes the array is sorted in ascending order, [begin] is lowest and [end] is highest.

binarySearch

public static <T> int binarySearch(T[] arr,
                                   int li,
                                   int ri,
                                   T key,
                                   Comparator<? super T> cmp)
Search a range of the given array using binary search. We use this because the corresponding method in java.util.Arrays is only available in JDK6 or later. Note that this implementation behaves exactly the same way as the one from Arrays, as opposed to binarySearch(long[], long, int, int). In particular, the right endpoint here is exclusive. TODO JDK6: make this @deprecated when we move to JDK6.

Throws:
ClassCastException - if the comparator is null and the array contains elements that are not Comparable, or the comparator cannot handle any elements of the array.
IllegalArgumentException - if li > ri
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if li < 0 or ri > arr.length.

trimLines

public static String trimLines(String str)
Remove empty lines and trim head/trailing space

Parameters:
str - string to be trimmed
Returns:
result string
